Name: Filter Appointments by Single Date
Description: Apply a single date filter on the appointments list and verify only appointments on that date are shown
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page with appointments spanning multiple dates
Expected Output: Only appointments whose appointment_date equals the selected date are displayed; count matches DB query

Name: Filter Appointments by Date Range
Description: Apply a start and end date range and verify appointments within inclusive range
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page with appointments before; within; and after range
Expected Output: Only appointments with appointment_date >= start_date and <= end_date are displayed

Name: Filter Appointments by Status
Description: Select a status filter e.g. Confirmed and verify results
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page with mixed statuses
Expected Output: Only appointments with status=Confirmed are displayed

Name: Filter Appointments by Doctor
Description: Filter appointments by a specific doctor and verify results
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page with appointments for multiple doctors
Expected Output: Only appointments assigned to the selected doctor are displayed

Name: Combined Filters Date + Status + Doctor
Description: Apply multiple filters simultaneously and verify intersection of criteria
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page with data covering combinations
Expected Output: Only appointments matching all selected filters are displayed

Name: Filter Appointments with No Matches
Description: Apply filters that yield no results e.g. future date + unavailable doctor
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list page
Expected Output: UI shows empty state message No appointments found and no rows

Name: Clear Filters
Description: Apply filters then use Clear action and verify full list returns
Prerequisites: User has applied at least one filter
Expected Output: All filters reset to defaults and full unfiltered appointment list is displayed

Name: Partial Text Match for Patient Name Doctor view
Description: Filter by partial patient name e.g. Ann matches Anna and Annette
Prerequisites: User is on Doctor's Appointments list with patients having similar names
Expected Output: Results include appointments for patients whose names contain the partial string case-insensitive

Name: Case Insensitive Filtering
Description: Use mixed-case filter values e.g. cOnfIrMeD and verify behavior
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list with statuses in lowercase and uppercase
Expected Output: Filtering is case-insensitive and returns correct matches

Name: Filter Doctors by Specialty Patient view
Description: Apply specialty filter in Doctor Directory and verify results
Prerequisites: User is on Doctor Directory with doctors of various specialties
Expected Output: Only doctors whose specialty matches the selected specialty are shown

Name: Filter Doctors by Location
Description: Apply location filter and verify results
Prerequisites: User is on Doctor Directory with doctors in multiple locations
Expected Output: Only doctors whose location equals the selected location are shown

Name: Filter Doctors by Availability
Description: Filter doctors by available flag and verify only currently available doctors are shown
Prerequisites: User is on Doctor Directory with mixed availability states
Expected Output: Only doctors with available=true are displayed

Name: Pagination with Filters Applied
Description: Apply filters and navigate to page 2 of results; verify filters persist and results are correct
Prerequisites: User has more than page_size filtered results
Expected Output: Page 2 shows the next slice of filtered results; filters remain applied

Name: Sorting + Filtering Interaction
Description: Apply a filter then sort by appointment time; verify sorting applies to filtered set
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list with multiple filtered rows
Expected Output: Filtered results are sorted by selected column correctly

Name: Invalid Date Input Handling
Description: Enter malformed date string in date filter input and submit
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments filter panel
Expected Output: Client-side validation prevents submission and shows validation error; backend rejects malformed query if reached

Name: SQL Injection Special Characters
Description: Enter SQL-like input or special characters in text filters e.g. ' OR 1=1 --
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments or Doctor Directory filter inputs
Expected Output: Input is sanitized and parameterized; no injection occurs; either no matches or safe error message

Name: Very Large Result Set Performance
Description: Apply a broad filter expected to return thousands of rows and measure response time
Prerequisites: Test environment seeded with large dataset
Expected Output: API responds within SLA e.g. <2s for first page and UI remains responsive; pagination used

Name: Filter State Persistence on Refresh
Description: Apply filters then refresh the browser; verify filters persist if designed to persist
Prerequisites: User is on Appointments list with filters applied
Expected Output: If persistence expected filters remain and results unchanged; expected behavior is persistence via query params

Name: Filter URL Query Parameters
Description: Apply filters and verify the URL contains corresponding query parameters and can be shared
Prerequisites: User applies filters
Expected Output: URL updates to include filter params; visiting URL reproduces same filtered view

Name: Filter Input Debounce Throttle
Description: Type rapidly into a live-search filter and verify backend calls are debounced
Prerequisites: Live-search enabled on patientName or doctorName fields
Expected Output: Backend receives requests at controlled intervals debounced; UI updates smoothly without excessive requests

Name: Filter Edge Case Timezone Boundary
Description: Filter by date time that falls on DST or timezone boundary and verify correct inclusion
Prerequisites: Appointments exist at timezone boundary times
Expected Output: Filtering uses user's locale timezone and includes appointments that fall within the selected local date time range

Name: Filter Accessibility Keyboard Only
Description: Apply filters using keyboard navigation only and verify functionality
Prerequisites: User navigates UI with keyboard
Expected Output: All filter controls are reachable and operable via keyboard; results update as expected

Name: Filter with Attached Records Indicator
Description: Filter appointments and verify that appointments with attached patient records show attachment indicator
Prerequisites: Appointments include some with uploaded records
Expected Output: Filtered list shows attachment icon or indicator for appointments that have attachments

Name: Concurrent Filter Changes by Multiple Users
Description: Simulate two users applying different filters concurrently and verify isolation
Prerequisites: Two sessions on same dataset
Expected Output: Each session shows results according to its own filters; no cross-session leakage

Name: Empty Filter Inputs Treated as Wildcard
Description: Leave optional filter fields empty and apply others; verify empty fields do not restrict results
Prerequisites: User applies only one of several optional filters
Expected Output: Only the provided filters are applied; empty fields are ignored
